title: FTTH_FIB-Tool Implement the Basics (Q4/24)
description:
Description
Business Requirements
1. Location Database
Locations are stored in a databse, which can be retrieved by retrieving the FIB Tool for that customer.
Locations from the database can be selected and added to a project. Opening FIB again according to a project, the selected custoer locations to that project are opened
Link for Data within database: https://telekom.sharepoint.de/:x:/r/sites/B2B_OfferManagementSolution_all/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B4B85D3F7-9485-4DFD-A83F-E1C68A14985B%7D&file=FIB%20Tool%20Daten.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true
Miro board link: https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVKk4uJGA=/ Password: PANDA_FIB
2. Adding customer locations in FIB
Customer locations in FIB can be added the following way:
2.1 manuall
incrementell: locations can be added manual via an incremental enter. FIB always suggest valid locations on the Basis of KLS data, see example screenshot:
KLS Search: locations can be added manual via entering a KLS ID. FIB shows the valid Location of KLS, see screenshot:
free text search: Locations can be added via a free text search of adress data. FIB shows the valid location of KLS, see screenshot:
2.2 Excel Down/Upload:
Locations can be added by downloading an empty excel template. The location data can then be added by the user within the Excel template and uploaded into the FIB system.
Excel template for the download can be found here: https://telekom.sharepoint.de/:x:/r/sites/B2B_OfferManagementSolution_all/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B4B85D3F7-9485-4DFD-A83F-E1C68A14985B%7D&file=FIB%20Tool%20Daten.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true)
2.3 Check of Dublettes:
Added locations are checked for dublettes.
A location is a dublette if following information are already available in the database: 
Country* ZIPCode* City* Locality Street* No* NoExtension Gebäude Etage Raum AGP/GP ID
workflow for dublettes for user is implemented: UX Design link
  3. KLS Validation for national Locations (DE)
when national locations are added, a KLS validation is done. 
The KLS data (KLS ID, ONKZ, ASB, Google Maps)  is added automatically accordingly when a location can be found.
The KLS Data is always read-only and not changeable for the user.
When locations are added uploaded, the KLS validation is done via the upload. If a national cannot be found within KLS, the location is added at the top of the location list (red) (suggestion function for valid KLS location will come in Q1).
This way we assure that only valid national locations are added in FIB.
Some adresses have missing Geo-Data within KLS (appr. 1mio adresses), especially geo-data and ASB. FIB allows to add also locations with missing KLS-data, but will show these in the GUI:
  4. Excel Download
in order to also use the data for other products /configurations, users can download an excel template of existing locations and data from the FIB Tool.
The excel Download will be identical as the excel upload, but including all data from FIB of the customer 
  5. Edit locations
once a location is added to the database, non location data can be edited in FIB via an edit button . If the user is editign a location inside FIB, the Pop-up for entering a location is opened.
Following adress data can not be edited (read-only): 
FIB Site ID Country* ZIPCode* City* Locality Street* No* NoExtension Gebäude Etage Raum AGP/GP ID
Reason for this, is that the system will generate a FIB site ID for a specific adress. 
If another adress wants to be added, the user can always add a new location.
  6. Usability Functions (filter, customize function){}
the location table can be customized to a user specific demand:
The location table can be filtered, single and mass filter is possible
  7. FIB Site ID
each location is getting a FIB Site ID generated automatically by the system. This is a numerical number, one-to-one for that specific location. The FIB site ID cannot be changed by the user.

Business Scope:
FIB-tool shell be used especially for our L and XL customers, but can be used segment independent for all customers.
The infrastructure workflow Tool (FIB) shell support:
- FIB supports the overall process for large customers for infrastructure expansion with fiber optics:
1: request fiber availability status
2: Entry in technic database of interested parties
3: Order removal, comply with HTN if necessary ???? Abstimmung FS / Realisierung notwendig
4: Order additional GF-TAs if necessary ???? Abstimmung FS / Realisierung notwendig
    (Order new GF-TA or add additional GF-TA for already existing access)
5: Order notifications/updates about location and fiber id status
- FIB is a project management / rollout management tool with a focus on address and location mgmt for larger customers/many locations
- FIB integrates into the existing application landscape and does not replace it (shell be possible to integrate from many systems, SAP CPQ; customer portal, Salesforce, ServiceNow etc.)
